channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Bonds That Once Haunted Banks Are Now Juicing Profits
item.description: Banks are expecting a bump to their core banking income as older, lower-yielding bonds mature and can be reinvested at today’s far higher yields.

item.title: Your Money in the New Trump Administration: Four Things to Watch
item.description: Taxes, crypto, student loans and mortgages might be in for big changes over the next four years.

item.title: L.A. landlords accused of price gouging say they’re responding to unprecedented demand from wealthy wildfire victims
item.description: Some landlords lowered rents after MarketWatch asked about increases that appeared to violate laws against price gouging.

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Higher
item.description: Gold settled 1.2% higher and silver rose nearly 0.7%, with both metals up for three consecutive sessions.

item.title: American Express to Pay $230 Million in Fines for Aggressive Sales Practices
item.description: The Wall Street Journal had reported on a series of deceptive and strong-arm tactics the card company used to increase small business sign-ups.

item.title: Oil ends lower, with U.S. prices failing to hold above $80 a barrel
item.description: Oil futures settled lower on Thursday, pulling back as news of an Israel-Hamas cease-fire deal helped to ease some worries about risks to global suppl...

item.title: Crypto will not save America’s state and local pensions
item.description: U.S. state and local pension funds are looking at speculating on cryptocurrencies to solve their funding crisis.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Slip; Investors Dig Into More Bank Earnings
item.description: The Nasdaq, S&P 500 and Dow industrials were pulled lower by declines in tech shares. Bank of America and Morgan Stanley said profit more than doubled...

item.title: Trump’s pick to lead HUD faces the least affordable housing market in recent history. 3 takeaways from his confirmation hearing.
item.description: Scott Turner, a former NFL player who served in the first Trump administration, fielded questions from lawmakers as the potential next Housing and Urb...

item.title: That big one-day stock-market surge we just had? Don’t make too much of it.
item.description: Price spikes happen in bear markets more often than in bull markets.
